page.title: 03SURVEYS
page.content: We interviewed about 70 people in the shopping areas of Dunstable. Most people seemed to be satisfied with the facilities in the area, quite a few thought they were good, and only a few considered them poor. Almost everyone thought that the shopping areas could be made cleaner, or more attractive. Most people thought that food shops in Dunstable were good, and you could buy what you wanted. Most people shop in Dunstable to buy food. Many bought clothes and household goods. Many people shop weekly, others two or three times a month. Half of the people didn't think there should be more local post offices, and the other half thought there should. Many people shopped in other towns.
